content.description:
A fairly obvious easy looking pinnacle behind the main Castle Waterman face. The low angle front seems like an obvious (if easy) feature to climb and is probably somewhere in the 5.2-5.6 range. The rock is a bit lose so top-roping may be a better option than leading.

It's possible to set a top rope anchor using trad gear by scrambling to the top around the back side. There are no bolts at the top, so it's necessary to down scramble after climbing it to clean your anchor.

If you know the FA or the name, let me know and I'll change it.
content.protection: Trad gear needed for anchor. It's a bit of a scramble to the the top from the backside and to be honest, the moves to get up there are probably harder than those on the face itself, though much less exposed.
content.location: This rock is behind the main Castle Waterman face and accessible by going around the right side of the Castle Waterman face until it comes into view.

climbs.name: Steve
climbs.fa: The guy from those Isuzu commercials back in the day, solo, with a twinkie and no chalk MAN!

content.description: Route starts up a 5.7 crack with sandy rock and enters the CAVE OF SHAME! Climb up through cave of shame to the end, and traverse left over bulge with hands in fist crack (#3 cam), then up. Follow slightly zigzagging system of corners with interesting and slightly awkward moves on pretty damn nice rock at this point. Route ends at old cool tree of some sort. Not a Pine, something else.
content.protection:
-Double rack from .1-3, maybe a 4, and some nuts. I think I placed one somewhat-large offset nut.

-Buncha slings, including 3-4 doubles.

-20ft or so static rope for anchor.

-60m rope minimum. Route is nearly exactly 30m long. Can TR with a 60m.
content.location: Check the photo. North face of Waterman Castle.

content.description: Follow slanting crack of Steve up to base of Cave of Shame. Traverse left on slippery sandy steep slab moves with underclings and funky pro to crack on left. Rock quality deteriorates significantly and protection becomes challenging/nonexistant. Continue up fist cracks and awkward moves to top. Terrible.
content.location: Left of Steve. Line is clear from the bottom.
